content.description:
Climb face and flared seams near middle of the wall (right of Fender Bender).  Look for the bolts. 

  Can toprope the seams to the left as well, all seem about 5.8
content.location: Right next to the parking lot.   Anchors at top.

content.description:
More excellent climbing trending slightly left up the face and seams following bolts and gear before a runout over easier terrain to a shared anchor with Leisure Boy.

 3 bolts and small gear.

 High first bolt with healthy spacing between bolts and gear.
content.location: Furthest right route on the wall

content.description:
Excellent climbing up the face and seam directly to the right of White Slab with a healthy spacing between bolts and gear.

 3 bolts and gear to a shared anchor with White Slab.
content.location: Second route from right route on the wall.

content.description: According to Dinger, it’s a newly equipped route between guides 3 and white slab. Mixed line equipped on lead. Small cams in seam above 2 bolts, and a #1 or #2 out right after last bolt. - Nov 12, 2018Fun, well protected slab, leads to runout easier climbing above.
content.protection: Mixed.  3 bolts. A couple small cams.
content.location: Climb up the slab to the first bolted line about 40’ to the right of the big, Fender Bender corner. Vince Buffalini has an excellent beta photo on the Leisure Boy route page.  This route is the line not marked on that photo, to the left of the climber on Wite Slab.

content.description: The base of the route is the crux.  It is a slabby area with few handholds.  It is a fun slabby problem.  If you arms are pumped this slab could be the solution.
content.protection: This route has a set of chains at the top.
content.location: This route is to the right of Guides Wall #2.  It is the second worn crack/seam to the right of Fender Bender.

content.description: The base of the route is the crux.  There are few hand and footholds.  As you climb the footholds become more available.
content.protection: Top rope only there are no places to place protection.  This route shares the chains with Fender Bender.
content.location: The route is just to the right of Fender Bender.  The base is a slab, then follow the heavily worn crack.  It is a fun route.

content.description: Climb the slab to the flake, then cork screws back to face climbing on the right.  I put a PG13 rating of this b/c any fall would send you into the off-width for a very awkward landing.
content.location: The obvious curving crack seen from the parking lot

content.description: White and red wall in front of the Sandstone Quarry parking lot.
